trans-unit.source: Handle conflicts with offline data in Mobile Services (iOS) | Mobile Dev Center
trans-unit.target: Handle conflicts with offline data in Mobile Services (iOS) | Mobile Dev Center

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services to handle conflicts when syncing offline data in your iOS application
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services to handle conflicts when syncing offline data in your iOS application

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to synchronize data and handle conflicts when using the offline capabilities of Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to synchronize data and handle conflicts when using the offline capabilities of Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial builds on the steps and the sample app from the previous tutorial [Get Started with Offline Data].
trans-unit.target: This tutorial builds on the steps and the sample app from the previous tutorial [Get Started with Offline Data].

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must first complete [Get Started with Offline Data].
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must first complete [Get Started with Offline Data].

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need a Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need a Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Azure Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Azure Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps:

trans-unit.source: [Update the App Project to Allow Editing]
trans-unit.target: [Update the App Project to Allow Editing]

trans-unit.source: [Update Todo List View Controller]
trans-unit.target: [Update Todo List View Controller]

trans-unit.source: [Add Todo Item View Controller]
trans-unit.target: [Add Todo Item View Controller]

trans-unit.source: [Add Todo Item View Controller and Segue to Storyboard]
trans-unit.target: [Add Todo Item View Controller and Segue to Storyboard]

trans-unit.source: [Add Item Details to Todo Item View Controller]
trans-unit.target: [Add Item Details to Todo Item View Controller]

trans-unit.source: [Add Support for Saving Edits]
trans-unit.target: [Add Support for Saving Edits]

trans-unit.source: [Conflict Handling Problem]
trans-unit.target: [Conflict Handling Problem]

trans-unit.source: [Update QSTodoService to Support Conflict Handling]
trans-unit.target: [Update QSTodoService to Support Conflict Handling]

trans-unit.source: [Add UI Alert View Helper to Support Conflict Handling]
trans-unit.target: [Add UI Alert View Helper to Support Conflict Handling]

trans-unit.source: [Add Conflict Handler to Todo List View Controller]
trans-unit.target: [Add Conflict Handler to Todo List View Controller]

trans-unit.source: [Test the App]
trans-unit.target: [Test the App]

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions at the [Get Started with Offline Data] tutorial and complete that project.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions at the [Get Started with Offline Data] tutorial and complete that project.

trans-unit.source: We will use the finished project from that tutorial as the starting point for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: We will use the finished project from that tutorial as the starting point for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Let's update the finished project from [Get Started with Offline Data] to allow the editing of items.
trans-unit.target: Let's update the finished project from [Get Started with Offline Data] to allow the editing of items.

trans-unit.source: Currently, if you run this same app on two phones, change the same item on both phones locally, and push the changes back to the server, it will fail with a conflict.
trans-unit.target: Currently, if you run this same app on two phones, change the same item on both phones locally, and push the changes back to the server, it will fail with a conflict.

trans-unit.source: The offline sync features in the SDK let you handle such conflicts via code and let you dynamically decide what to do with conflicting items.
trans-unit.target: The offline sync features in the SDK let you handle such conflicts via code and let you dynamically decide what to do with conflicting items.

trans-unit.source: Changing the quickstart project lets us experiment with this feature.
trans-unit.target: Changing the quickstart project lets us experiment with this feature.

trans-unit.source: Select MainStoryboard_iPhone.storyboard in the Xcode Project Navigator, then select Todo List View Controller.
trans-unit.target: Select MainStoryboard_iPhone.storyboard in the Xcode Project Navigator, then select Todo List View Controller.

trans-unit.source: Select the table view cell, and sets its Accessory mode to Disclosure indicator.
trans-unit.target: Select the table view cell, and sets its Accessory mode to Disclosure indicator.

trans-unit.source: The disclosure indicator indicates to users that if they tap on the associated table view controller, a new view will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: The disclosure indicator indicates to users that if they tap on the associated table view controller, a new view will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: The disclosure indicator produces no event.
trans-unit.target: The disclosure indicator produces no event.

trans-unit.source: In TodoListViewController.m, remove the following operations and their contents altogether.
trans-unit.target: In TodoListViewController.m, remove the following operations and their contents altogether.

trans-unit.source: We do not need them:
trans-unit.target: We do not need them:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Cocoa Touch class named QSItemViewController, derived from UIViewController.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Cocoa Touch class named QSItemViewController, derived from UIViewController.

trans-unit.source: In QSItemViewController.h add the following type definition:
trans-unit.target: In QSItemViewController.h add the following type definition:

trans-unit.source: In QSItemViewController.h, add a property to hold the item to be modified, and a property for the callback that is invoked after the user presses the back button in the detail view:
trans-unit.target: In QSItemViewController.h, add a property to hold the item to be modified, and a property for the callback that is invoked after the user presses the back button in the detail view:

trans-unit.source: In QSItemViewController.m, add two private properties for the two fields of the todo item we'll edit -- the completion status and the text of the todo item itself:
trans-unit.target: In QSItemViewController.m, add two private properties for the two fields of the todo item we'll edit -- the completion status and the text of the todo item itself:

trans-unit.source: In QSItemViewController.m, update the stub implementation of viewDidLoad to the following code:
trans-unit.target: In QSItemViewController.m, update the stub implementation of viewDidLoad to the following code:

trans-unit.source: In QSItemViewController.m, add four additional methods to handle edited control events:
trans-unit.target: In QSItemViewController.m, add four additional methods to handle edited control events:

trans-unit.source: In QSItemViewController, also add the following method, which is called when the user presses the Back button in the Navigation Bar.
trans-unit.target: In QSItemViewController, also add the following method, which is called when the user presses the Back button in the Navigation Bar.

trans-unit.source: The method can be called on other events, so we first check the parent view.
trans-unit.target: The method can be called on other events, so we first check the parent view.

trans-unit.source: If there has been any change to the item, then self.item is modified and the callback editCompleteBlock is called:
trans-unit.target: If there has been any change to the item, then self.item is modified and the callback editCompleteBlock is called:

trans-unit.source: Return to the MainStoryboard_iPhone.storyboard file using the Project Navigator.
trans-unit.target: Return to the MainStoryboard_iPhone.storyboard file using the Project Navigator.

trans-unit.source: Add a new view controller for the Todo Item to the storyboard, to the right of the existing Todo List View Controller.
trans-unit.target: Add a new view controller for the Todo Item to the storyboard, to the right of the existing Todo List View Controller.

trans-unit.source: Set the custom class of this new view controller to QSItemViewController.
trans-unit.target: Set the custom class of this new view controller to QSItemViewController.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see [Adding a Scene to a Storyboard].
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see [Adding a Scene to a Storyboard].

trans-unit.source: Add a Show segue from the Todo List View Controller to the Todo Item View Controller.
trans-unit.target: Add a Show segue from the Todo List View Controller to the Todo Item View Controller.

trans-unit.source: Then, in the Attributes Inspector, set the segue identifier to detailSegue.
trans-unit.target: Then, in the Attributes Inspector, set the segue identifier to detailSegue.

trans-unit.source: Don't create this segue from the any cell or button in the origin view controller.
trans-unit.target: Don't create this segue from the any cell or button in the origin view controller.

trans-unit.source: Instead, CTRL + Drag from the view controller icon above the Todo List View Controller in the storyboard interface to the Todo Item View Controller:
trans-unit.target: Instead, CTRL + Drag from the view controller icon above the Todo List View Controller in the storyboard interface to the Todo Item View Controller:

trans-unit.source: If you accidentally segue from a cell, you will trigger the segue twice when you run the app, resulting in this error:
trans-unit.target: If you accidentally segue from a cell, you will trigger the segue twice when you run the app, resulting in this error:

trans-unit.source: To learn more about segues, see [Adding a Segue Between Scenes in a Storyboard].
trans-unit.target: To learn more about segues, see [Adding a Segue Between Scenes in a Storyboard].

trans-unit.source: Add a text field for item text and a segmented control for the completion status to the new Todo Item View Controller, with labels as well.
trans-unit.target: Add a text field for item text and a segmented control for the completion status to the new Todo Item View Controller, with labels as well.

trans-unit.source: In the segmented control, set the title of Segment 0 to Yes and the title for Segment 1 to No.
trans-unit.target: In the segmented control, set the title of Segment 0 to Yes and the title for Segment 1 to No.

trans-unit.source: Connect these new fields to outlets in code.
trans-unit.target: Connect these new fields to outlets in code.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see [Build a User Interface] and [Segmented Controls].
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see [Build a User Interface] and [Segmented Controls].

trans-unit.source: Connect these new fields to the corresponding outlets you've already added to QSItemViewController.m.
trans-unit.target: Connect these new fields to the corresponding outlets you've already added to QSItemViewController.m.

trans-unit.source: Connect the item text field to the itemText outlet and the completion status segmented control to the itemComplete outlet.
trans-unit.target: Connect the item text field to the itemText outlet and the completion status segmented control to the itemComplete outlet.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see [Creating an Outlet Connection].
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see [Creating an Outlet Connection].

trans-unit.source: Set the text field's delegate to the view controller.
trans-unit.target: Set the text field's delegate to the view controller.

trans-unit.source: CTRL + Drag from the text field to the view controller icon below the Todo Item View Controller in the storyboard interface, and select the delegate outlet; this indicates to the storyboard that this text field's delegate is this view controller.
trans-unit.target: CTRL + Drag from the text field to the view controller icon below the Todo Item View Controller in the storyboard interface, and select the delegate outlet; this indicates to the storyboard that this text field's delegate is this view controller.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the app works with all the changes you've made so far.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the app works with all the changes you've made so far.

trans-unit.source: Run the app now in the simulator.
trans-unit.target: Run the app now in the simulator.

trans-unit.source: Add items to the todo list, and then click on them.
trans-unit.target: Add items to the todo list, and then click on them.

trans-unit.source: You'll see the (currently empty) item view controller.
trans-unit.target: You'll see the (currently empty) item view controller.

trans-unit.source: We will refer to QSItemViewController from QSTodoListViewController.m.
trans-unit.target: We will refer to QSItemViewController from QSTodoListViewController.m.

trans-unit.source: So, in QSTodoListViewController.m, let's add a line to import QSItemViewController.h.
trans-unit.target: So, in QSTodoListViewController.m, let's add a line to import QSItemViewController.h.

trans-unit.source: Add a new property to the QSTodoListViewController interface in QSTodoListViewController.m to store the item being edited:
trans-unit.target: Add a new property to the QSTodoListViewController interface in QSTodoListViewController.m to store the item being edited:

trans-unit.source: Implement tableView:didSelectRowAtIndexPath: in QSTodoListViewController.m to save the item being edited and then to call the segue to display the detail view.
trans-unit.target: Implement tableView:didSelectRowAtIndexPath: in QSTodoListViewController.m to save the item being edited and then to call the segue to display the detail view.

trans-unit.source: Implement prepareForSegue:sender: in QSTodoListViewController.m to pass the item to the Todo Item View Controller, and specify the callback when the user exits the detail view:
trans-unit.target: Implement prepareForSegue:sender: in QSTodoListViewController.m to pass the item to the Todo Item View Controller, and specify the callback when the user exits the detail view:

trans-unit.source: Verify that the app works with all the changes you've made so far.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the app works with all the changes you've made so far.

trans-unit.source: Run the app now in the simulator.
trans-unit.target: Run the app now in the simulator.

trans-unit.source: Add items to the todo list, and then click on them.
trans-unit.target: Add items to the todo list, and then click on them.

trans-unit.source: You'll see the item view controller is no longer empty -- it displays the details of the todo items.
trans-unit.target: You'll see the item view controller is no longer empty -- it displays the details of the todo items.

trans-unit.source: When you click the "Back" button in the navigation view, the edits are lost.
trans-unit.target: When you click the "Back" button in the navigation view, the edits are lost.

trans-unit.source: We've sent data to the detail view, but the data isn't sent back to the master view.
trans-unit.target: We've sent data to the detail view, but the data isn't sent back to the master view.

trans-unit.source: Since we already pass a pointer to a copy of the item, we can use that pointer to retrieve the list of updates made to the item and update it on the server.
trans-unit.target: Since we already pass a pointer to a copy of the item, we can use that pointer to retrieve the list of updates made to the item and update it on the server.

trans-unit.source: To get started, first update the server wrapper class of QSTodoService in QSTodoService.m by removing the completeItem operation and adding a new updateItem operation.
trans-unit.target: To get started, first update the server wrapper class of QSTodoService in QSTodoService.m by removing the completeItem operation and adding a new updateItem operation.

trans-unit.source: This is because completeItem only marks items as complete; instead, updateItem will update items.
trans-unit.target: This is because completeItem only marks items as complete; instead, updateItem will update items.

trans-unit.source: Remove the declaration for completeItem from QSTodoService.h and add this declaration for updateItem:
trans-unit.target: Remove the declaration for completeItem from QSTodoService.h and add this declaration for updateItem:

trans-unit.source: Now let's test the app.
trans-unit.target: Now let's test the app.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the app works with all the changes you've made so far.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the app works with all the changes you've made so far.

trans-unit.source: Run the app now in the simulator.
trans-unit.target: Run the app now in the simulator.

trans-unit.source: Add items to the todo list, and then click on them.
trans-unit.target: Add items to the todo list, and then click on them.

trans-unit.source: Try to edit an item, and go back.
trans-unit.target: Try to edit an item, and go back.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the item description is updated in the app's master view.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the item description is updated in the app's master view.

trans-unit.source: Refresh the app using the drag-down gesture, and verify that the edit is reflected in your remote service.
trans-unit.target: Refresh the app using the drag-down gesture, and verify that the edit is reflected in your remote service.

trans-unit.source: Let's examine what happens when two different clients try to modify the same piece of data at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Let's examine what happens when two different clients try to modify the same piece of data at the same time.

trans-unit.source: In the example list below, there's an item "Mobile Services is Cool!"
trans-unit.target: In the example list below, there's an item "Mobile Services is Cool!"

trans-unit.source: Let's change this to, say, "I love Mobile Services!"
trans-unit.target: Let's change this to, say, "I love Mobile Services!"

trans-unit.source: on one device and let's change this to "I love Azure!"
trans-unit.target: on one device and let's change this to "I love Azure!"

trans-unit.source: on another device.
trans-unit.target: on another device.

trans-unit.source: Launch the app in two places: on two iOS devices, or in the simulator and on an iOS device.
trans-unit.target: Launch the app in two places: on two iOS devices, or in the simulator and on an iOS device.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have a physical device to test on, launch one instance in the simulator, and using a REST client, send a PATCH request to the mobile service.The URL of the PATCH request reflects the name of the Mobile Service, the name of the todo item table, and the ID of the todo item table you're editing, while the x-zumo-application header is the application key:
trans-unit.target: If you don't have a physical device to test on, launch one instance in the simulator, and using a REST client, send a PATCH request to the mobile service.The URL of the PATCH request reflects the name of the Mobile Service, the name of the todo item table, and the ID of the todo item table you're editing, while the x-zumo-application header is the application key:

trans-unit.source: Now, refresh the items in the two instances of the app.
trans-unit.target: Now, refresh the items in the two instances of the app.

trans-unit.source: You'll see an error printed in the output log in Xcode:
trans-unit.target: You'll see an error printed in the output log in Xcode:

trans-unit.source: This is because on the completion block, in the call to pullWithQuery:completion:, the error parameter will be non-nil, which will cause the error to be printed out to the output via NSLog.
trans-unit.target: This is because on the completion block, in the call to pullWithQuery:completion:, the error parameter will be non-nil, which will cause the error to be printed out to the output via NSLog.

trans-unit.source: Let's let the user decide how to handle the conflict by dealing with it in the client.
trans-unit.target: Let's let the user decide how to handle the conflict by dealing with it in the client.

trans-unit.source: To do this, let's implement the MSSyncContextDelegate protocol.
trans-unit.target: To do this, let's implement the MSSyncContextDelegate protocol.

trans-unit.source: In both QSTodoService.h and QSTodoService.m, change the (QSTodoService *)defaultService; factory method declaration to the statement below, so as to receive the sync context delegate as a parameter:
trans-unit.target: In both QSTodoService.h and QSTodoService.m, change the (QSTodoService *)defaultService; factory method declaration to the statement below, so as to receive the sync context delegate as a parameter:

trans-unit.source: In QSTodoService.m, change the init line as shown below, again receiving the sync context delegate as a parameter:
trans-unit.target: In QSTodoService.m, change the init line as shown below, again receiving the sync context delegate as a parameter:

trans-unit.source: In QSTodoService.m, change the init call in defaultServiceWithDelegate to initWithDelegate instead:
trans-unit.target: In QSTodoService.m, change the init call in defaultServiceWithDelegate to initWithDelegate instead:

trans-unit.source: Back in QSTodoService.m, change the initialization of self.client.syncContext to pass in syncDelegate instead of nil for the delegate:
trans-unit.target: Back in QSTodoService.m, change the initialization of self.client.syncContext to pass in syncDelegate instead of nil for the delegate:

trans-unit.source: If there's a conflict, let's allow the user to choose which version to keep:
trans-unit.target: If there's a conflict, let's allow the user to choose which version to keep:

trans-unit.source: keep the client version (which overrides the version on the server),
trans-unit.target: keep the client version (which overrides the version on the server),

trans-unit.source: keep the server version (which updates the client local table), or
trans-unit.target: keep the server version (which updates the client local table), or

trans-unit.source: keep neither version (cancels push and leaves the operation pending).
trans-unit.target: keep neither version (cancels push and leaves the operation pending).

trans-unit.source: Since another update may also happen while we display the prompt, we'll keep showing options until the server stops returning a failure response.
trans-unit.target: Since another update may also happen while we display the prompt, we'll keep showing options until the server stops returning a failure response.

trans-unit.source: In our code, let's use a helper class that shows an alert view and takes a delegate that is invoked when the alert view is displayed.
trans-unit.target: In our code, let's use a helper class that shows an alert view and takes a delegate that is invoked when the alert view is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Let's define the helper class QSUIAlertViewWithBlock first.
trans-unit.target: Let's define the helper class QSUIAlertViewWithBlock first.

trans-unit.source: Add this new class, QSUIAlertViewWithBlock, using Xcode, and overwrite QSUIAlertViewWithBlock.h with the following contents:
trans-unit.target: Add this new class, QSUIAlertViewWithBlock, using Xcode, and overwrite QSUIAlertViewWithBlock.h with the following contents:

trans-unit.source: Next, overwrite QSUIAlertViewWithBlock.m with the following file:
trans-unit.target: Next, overwrite QSUIAlertViewWithBlock.m with the following file:

trans-unit.source: In QSTodoListViewController.m, edit viewDidLoad.
trans-unit.target: In QSTodoListViewController.m, edit viewDidLoad.

trans-unit.source: Replace the call to defaultService with a call to defaultServiceWithDelegate instead:
trans-unit.target: Replace the call to defaultService with a call to defaultServiceWithDelegate instead:

trans-unit.source: In QSTodoListViewController.h, add <MSSyncContextDelegate> to the interface declaration so we're implementing the MSSyncContextDelegate protocol.
trans-unit.target: In QSTodoListViewController.h, add <MSSyncContextDelegate> to the interface declaration so we're implementing the MSSyncContextDelegate protocol.

trans-unit.source: Add the following import statement at the top of QSTodoListViewController.m:
trans-unit.target: Add the following import statement at the top of QSTodoListViewController.m:

trans-unit.source: Finally, let's add the following two operations to QSTodoListViewController.m to use this helper class and prompt the user to reconcile the conflict in one of three ways.
trans-unit.target: Finally, let's add the following two operations to QSTodoListViewController.m to use this helper class and prompt the user to reconcile the conflict in one of three ways.

trans-unit.source: Let's test the application with conflicts!
trans-unit.target: Let's test the application with conflicts!

trans-unit.source: Edit the same item in two different instances of the app running at the same time, or using the app and a REST client.
trans-unit.target: Edit the same item in two different instances of the app running at the same time, or using the app and a REST client.

trans-unit.source: Perform the refresh gesture in the app instances by dragging from the top.
trans-unit.target: Perform the refresh gesture in the app instances by dragging from the top.

trans-unit.source: Now you'll see a prompt to reconcile the conflict:
trans-unit.target: Now you'll see a prompt to reconcile the conflict:

trans-unit.source: In order to set up the completed project from [Get Started with Offline Data] to detect conflicts, you first added the ability to edit and update the todo items.
trans-unit.target: In order to set up the completed project from [Get Started with Offline Data] to detect conflicts, you first added the ability to edit and update the todo items.

trans-unit.source: To do so, you added a new item details view controller, connected the main view controller and the details view controller, and finally added the ability to save edits and push them to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: To do so, you added a new item details view controller, connected the main view controller and the details view controller, and finally added the ability to save edits and push them to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Next, you discovered what happens when there is a conflict.
trans-unit.target: Next, you discovered what happens when there is a conflict.

trans-unit.source: You added support for a conflict handler by implementing the MSSyncContextDelegate protocol.
trans-unit.target: You added support for a conflict handler by implementing the MSSyncContextDelegate protocol.

trans-unit.source: You also enabled support for the sync context delegate through the server interface class of QSTodoService, QSTodoListViewController, and supporting classes.
trans-unit.target: You also enabled support for the sync context delegate through the server interface class of QSTodoService, QSTodoListViewController, and supporting classes.

trans-unit.source: Along the way, you added a QSUIAlertViewWithBlock helper class to display an alert to users, and finished by adding code to QSTodoListViewController to prompt the user to reconcile the conflict in one of three ways.
trans-unit.target: Along the way, you added a QSUIAlertViewWithBlock helper class to display an alert to users, and finished by adding code to QSTodoListViewController to prompt the user to reconcile the conflict in one of three ways.
